content: muchness by susan ashcroft yarn can be knitted in any weight but yardage will vary with other weights the original was knitted with a single skein of madelinetosh tosh sport on 4 5mm/us 7 250m/275yds my gauge was approx 18sts in 10cm/4 needle size use a needle size that gives nice drape usually at least 1 size larger than recommended on the label abbreviations k = knit p = purl st s = stitch es rs/ws = right side/wrong side sl = slip purlwise wyif = with yarn in front wyib = with yarn in back use the 10% or even 5% test madelinetoshtosh sport on 4 5mm/us 7 knit 10% of your yarn by weight and then measure the colourway rainwater height multiply by 10 to know how long your strip you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked to the will be pattern page on ravelry - link if using only 5% multiply by 20 making the cowl cast on 42 stitches or other multiple of 5 + 2 using a provisional cast-on be sure to keep the yarn snug after slipping the 2 stitches so that you get a nice even edge row 1 rs sl2 wyib *p3 k2 repeat from * to the end of the row row 2 ws sl2 wyif *k1 p1 k1 p2 repeat from * to the end of the row repeat these 2 row until you like the length and are ready to finish i usually aim for about 130cm/50 but the best thing is to baste and try it on i d recommend you block the strip flat and then kitchener together the 2 ends with or without a twist © ashcroft-hempsall 2018 - for personal non-commercial use only
